In 1904, a group of prominent scholars from the Prussian Academy of Sciences asserted that “Clever Hans,” a horse, possessed near-human mathematical abilities.

Not everything you observe that seems to be due to #intelligence is in fact intelligent.

AXI-SCAPE #000 is done - the first of an upcoming series of #AxiDraw plotter paintings & re-interpretations of selected still frames of the practically infinite C-SCAPE (https://art.thi.ng/c-scape), my multi-cellular automata project from last year.

Just under 13 hours of painting/plotting! Altogether used 12 layers, 9 colors (Reeves watercolors), Clairefontaine cold-pressed paper (300grams), 3 brushes/sizes...

The entire painting is based on a single 1bit B&W bitmap image from which 12 different vector reconstructions (one per layer/color) are created. The following #ThingUmbrella packages provided 90% of the tooling:

- https://thi.ng/axidraw
- https://thi.ng/cellular
- https://thi.ng/geom
- https://thi.ng/geom-axidraw
- https://thi.ng/geom-trace-bitmap
- https://thi.ng/pixel
- https://thi.ng/transducers

The entire painting is based on a single 1bit B&W bitmap image from which 12 different vector reconstructions (one per layer/color) are created. The following #ThingUmbrella packages provided 90% of the tooling:

- https://thi.ng/axidraw
- https://thi.ng/cellular
- https://thi.ng/geom
- https://thi.ng/geom-axidraw
- https://thi.ng/geom-trace-bitmap
- https://thi.ng/pixel
- https://thi.ng/transducers

last_post.content:
Next event: "The ABCs of Getting Involved in Your Local Public Library."

https://www.librariesforthepeople.org/events/abcs

The transcript for the "Libraries at the End of the World" event is at https://www.streamtext.net/player/transcript?event=BCRW_Captions

It's important stuff. Please read it, to learn how to help US libraries survive under an onslaught of political destruction.

And please boost. Thanks.

i can’t imagine anyone could argue with the sentiment that research integrity matters, but there are people who argue about things for fun. (what’s that saying? you don’t have to have every argument you’re invited to?)

my problem with this: why is taylor & francis charging $50 for the article, $392 for the issue, $3500 / €3190 for a hybrid apc? why is this vitally important topic locked behind a paywall? it’s difficult to build trust and accountability when only part of your audience can participate in the conversation!

how can we continue to put our research on open access / scholarship / science in closed access journals? if the ethics are important enough to research and to write about, aren’t they important enough to live by?

(lib* folks are equally guilty of this. elsevier still publishes the journal of academic librarianship, sage the journal of librarianship and information science, t&f public librarian quarterly 😬)
